result.execSummary:
The defendant Donte Devel Shannon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

Defendant is eligible to participate in the in-jail BHS AODA program.  Upon completion, balance of jail time is STAYED. Huber for employment.
Concurrent with: Count 1 in 15CF279

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence. Huber for employment if revoked.
Consecutive to: count 1

Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: count 1

miscConds.notes: Obtain GED or HSED. Obtain and maintain full-time employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent. Do not go into any bars or liquor stores.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Enroll in counseling. Report to Racine Vocational Ministry Program.   Do not drive unless properly licensed. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

PLUS $3,000 CO SIGNATURE BOND W/ HIS FATHER NAKIA SHANNON DOB: 8-19-1975. 
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  No contact with family of victim in 15CF1010.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
**8/03/2015 GPS monitor, house arrest, may only leave house for court, meetings with his attorney and is allowed to go to Gateway to enroll in school with his father. **
08/31/15 - BOND AMENDED - Defendant to live with father at 1220 Grand Ave., Racine. Defendant may also leave home for work at Fair Oaks Farm and school at Workforce Development - with documentation, and when with father or authorized person for appointments - with documentation. No driving. 
10/12/15 - BOND AMENDED TO REMOVE ELM/HOUSE ARREST.

Defendant Donte Devel Shannon in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Def - Req adj to allow client time to pay restitution. Also req bond modified to remove ELM
St - No obj
BTC: Motion for bond modification granted - ELM/house arrest removed, must still live w/father at 1220 Grand Ave. Follow all house rules/curfew.  Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 11:00 am.
